title: Build Failed as DLLs not found in GAC Visual Studio Enterprise 2017
body:
Facing below errors while building the code on Build machine. For build the code we use VS 2017 with Target version as  .NET framework 4.6.1 in Project Settings.
 
Considered "System.Private.ServiceModel, Version=4.1.0.1, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", which was not found in the GAC.
Considered "System.ServiceModel.Duplex, Version=4.0.2.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", which was not found in the GAC.
Considered "System.Data.Common, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", which was not found in the GAC.
Considered "System.Diagnostics.StackTrace, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", which was not found in the GAC.
Considered "System.Globalization.Extensions, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", which was not found in the GAC.
Considered "System.Net.Sockets, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", which was not found in the GAC.

nodes.body: Team Triage: Could you provide a standalone project that reproduces this behavior? How are you referencing these assemblies in the project?
